data.title: Cyborg commando plasma will fly forever
data.body:
I was fooling around with TS and noticed that if you fire plasma at the correct location with a bunch of cyborgs, it will fly in a loop and never hit its target.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25407993-cyborg-commando-plasma-will-fly-forever?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: TS music download broken
data.body: Downloaded music from baxxster's us server, game restarts, no music to be found, asks to reinstall once again.

data.title: Added Tiberian Sun decorational actors
data.body: including boxes/crates, barrels and palettes which for some reasons are overlays in Tiberian Sun. We will make them normal actors. Kept the names compatible with the conversion code at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/compare/bleed...pchote:ts-map-importer#diff-0ae9cae5772783a57dba2df98e2bde26R82

data.title: Added missing lint references
data.body: and also found some other inconsistencies while browsing the source code.

data.title: Force helicopters to land before transforming.
data.body:
Fixes the issue shown in http://www.ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?p=534110

This does not need a flag because Transforms is not to be used for aircraft -> aircraft transformations.  We have the upgrade system for intra-actor state changes.

data.title: Added more variation to Tiberian Sun debris
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8686 to add more polish, but less unused trail and sync overhead.

data.title: `Trait` Abstract Base Class, `IsTraitEnabled`, and `IDisabledTrait.IsTraitDisabled`
GDI's gactwr does not accept tower.vulcan upgrade via Lua.
data.body:
``` yaml
    tower1: gactwr
        Location: 42,13
        Owner: player
        Health: 100
        Facing: 160
    tower2: gactwr
        Location: 42,17
        Owner: player
        Health: 100
        Facing: 160

Rules:
    World:
        -CrateSpawner:
        -SpawnMPUnits:
        -MPStartLocations:
        LuaScript:
            Scripts: map.lua
        ScriptUpgradesCache:
            Upgrades: tw_up
        -StartGameNotification:
```

``` lua
WorldLoaded = function()
    local tw_up = "tower.vulcan"

    if tower1.HasProperty("AcceptsUpgrade") then
        if tower1.AcceptsUpgrade(tw_up) then
            tower1.GrantUpgrade(tw_up)
        else
            Media.DisplayMessage("t1 doesn't accept " .. tw_up)
        end
    else
        Media.DisplayMessage("t1 doesn't accept upgrades")
    end

    if tower2.HasProperty("AcceptsUpgrade") then
        if tower2.AcceptsUpgrade(tw_up) then
            tower2.GrantUpgrade(tw_up)
        else
            Media.DisplayMessage("t2 doesn't accept " .. tw_up)
        end
    else
        Media.DisplayMessage("t2 doesn't accept upgrades")
    end
end
```

In-game I get `t1 doesn't accept tower.vulcan` and `t2 doesn't accept tower.vulcan`.

For completeness this is the trait that should accept `tower.vulcan` that is currently on `gactwr`:

``` yaml
    Armament@VULCPRIMARY:
        UpgradeTypes: tower.vulcan
        UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
        Weapon: VulcanTower
        LocalOffset: 768,85,512
        MuzzleSequence: muzzle
        MuzzleSplitFacings: 8
```

data.title: Enemy faction hidden in missions.
data.body: ![screen shot 2015-08-04 at 6 38 27 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/9075603/69583b0a-3adc-11e5-95c1-14abe0297c20.png)

data.title: Prevent shroud from being revealed outside the map cordon.
data.body:
Fixes #8947.  Also fixes a potential crash if somebody passed a coordinate outside the map (not bounds) area.

Easy testcase is to increase `MPStartLocations: InitialExploreRange` to a large value and then pick a spawn point near the edge in any mod.

data.title: Spawn point shroud reveal radius ignores map borders
data.body:
This gives some odd-looking results if the map's spawn point is too close to the edge, as revealed by #8921:

![spawns](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/9073875/7ff60174-3afc-11e5-90e3-461b3ac7ba21.png)

Note: this is not a TS-specific bug.  It can be reproduced in the other mods by setting a large InitialExploreRange.

data.title: Fix orphaned tooltips when dismissing a dropdown.
data.body:
This forces tooltips to be recalculated when a DropDownButtonWidget is dismissed.

Fixes #8944.

data.title: Reveal the initial resources if shroud is disabled.
data.body: Fixes #8943.

data.title: Faction tooltip remains visible after selecting a faction in the lobby.
Resources aren't revealed when starting a game with shroud disabled.
Add specific exception message when Explodes cannot find a weapon
data.body:
Additionally, accept empty string to 'disable' `Explodes` weapons.

Last but not least, since we define `UnitExplode` as default for both filled and empty weapon, the d2k grenadier used it when reloading(!), causing massive damage.

Adresses #8940 (or at least helps debugging that crash).

data.title: Revert "Sync inherited members."
data.body:
This reverts commit cfd2f265d5ef27972da9c54506fa6cb41434110c / #8858.
Closes #8937.

data.title: KeyNotFoundException at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Explodes.Killed(Actor self, AttackInfo e)
data.body:
http://pastebin.com/1PAPxGAP

```
<+pchote> that is probably related to damage types
<+pchote> i'll blame reaperr for that
<+pchote> can you please file a bug with that - this is something that we should at least be giving a sensible error message about
<+pchote> you can copy these four irc lines into the ticket if you want, in case someone else tells you "this is you doing x - not a bug"
<OmegaBolt___> so it could be nothing to do with what I did? :P
<+pchote> no, it probably is something you did
<+pchote> but openra sucks for not telling you that in a nicer way
```

data.title: Added checks for syntax errors in Lua scripts
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6879.

data.title: Have flying actors account for terrain height
data.body: Adresses #8547 partly.

data.title: Crash when trying to hash PoisonedByTiberium
data.body:
The TS map `Hot Springs` crashes for me with:

```
Tiberian Sun Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.MethodAccessException`: Attempt by method 'DynamicClass.Hash_UpgradableTrait`1(System.Object)' to access method 'DynamicClass.Hash_UpgradableTrait`1(System.Object)' failed.
   at Hash_UpgradableTrait`1(Object )
   at Hash_PoisonedByTiberium(Object )
   at OpenRA.Sync.CalculateSyncHash(Object obj) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Sync.cs:Line 35.
   at OpenRA.World.SyncHash() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 326.
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.Tick() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Network\OrderManager.cs:Line 208.
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 475.
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 507.
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 631.
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 671.
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 111.
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 39.
```

Caused by #8858. (Ping: @RoosterDragon)

> 14:29 (penev) it's caused by a civ1's PoisonedByTiberium
> 14:29 (penev) which the game tries to sync but fails
> 14:34 (penev) the exception says that Sync.HashFunctions has no entry for UpgradableTrait when you try to hash PoisonedByTiberium
> 14:35 (penev) perhaps it has something to do with the fact that both UpgradableTrait and PoisonedByTiberium have fields that need syncing

data.title: Improved the --check-yaml performance
data.body: This speeds up the linter by aborting early. It checks either mod or map and skips redundant checks such as unchanged rules.

data.title: Updated Travis to use Mono 4.0
data.body: See http://www.mono-project.com/docs/about-mono/releases/4.0.0/ for changes.

data.title: Reduced the bloated Travis CI Mono installation
data.body:
Due to https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/4571 and http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/languages/csharp/ including F#, Visual Basic and other stuff we don't need, I will try to reduce the VM setup by manually specifying just the dependencies we need.

:no_entry: **DON'T MERGE JUST YET. THIS IS A TEST UNTIL THIS MESSAGE IS REMOVED!**
